By Nikhil Bhatia Share - Make : Mahindra Model : XUV 3XO We Like Upmarket interior Strong engines Long equipment list We Don't Like Boot space Competent as the Mahindra XUV300 was, it never quite made it to the list of compact SUV bestsellers. Mahindra is now gunning for glory with the updated XUV300, christened the XUV 3XO. Mind you, this is no run-of-the-mill nip and tuck update. Mahindra has gone all out with a new look, redone interior, some class-first feature introductions, some class-best specifications and very enticing pricing. The aim is to take the fight to the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet and Hyundai Venue, and win. Mahindra XUV 3XO: design and styling Where the XUV300s styling was understated, the XUV 3XO is big on flash. Giving the 3XO its distinctive face are the large, new vertically oriented headlights outlined by C-shaped DRLs (a link to the larger XUV700). The headlights are split into two sections with a concealed projector unit up top, and an open projector fog lamp unit lower down, both set amidst a black surround. The lights flank the new grille, which is actually a gloss panel that runs much of the XUVs width. The new front bumper with its pronounced cuts and creases is very concept car-like and the newly contoured bonnet also does its bit to add volume to the design. New C-shaped LED DRLs provide a visual link with the larger XUV700. Like the XUV300, the 3XO looks muscular in profile, and furthering the impression are the stylish new 17-inch diamond cut alloy wheels that are the largest in the segment. Theres also chunkier side cladding with cuts at the wheel arches. Mahindra says ground clearance is a generous 201mm, up from the XUV300s figure of 180mm. final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO represents a significant upgrade in the compact SUV segment, targeting value-conscious customers who seek a premium experience. Its exterior design is a departure from its predecessor, the XUV300, with a more modern and eye-catching aesthetic. The front fascia features vertically oriented headlights flanked by C-shaped DRLs, visually connecting it to the larger XUV700. Diamond-shaped detailing is evident in the lights and grille, adding a touch of sophistication. The new front bumper and contoured bonnet contribute to a more voluminous appearance. The available 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, the largest in the segment, enhance the vehicle's sporty appeal.

Inside, the XUV 3XO aims to elevate the cabin experience with premium features and materials. Reviews suggest interior quality comparable to Hyundai, a brand known for its well-appointed interiors. The dual 10.25-inch digital displays create a modern and immersive environment, with one serving as the infotainment screen and the other as the instrument cluster. Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto connectivity provide seamless smartphone integration. Some models offer a panoramic sunroof, further enhancing the sense of spaciousness and luxury. The Harman Kardon audio system, a supplier to luxury brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz, delivers high-fidelity sound. Features like a 360-degree camera, auto headlamps and wipers, and wireless smartphone charging contribute to convenience and a premium feel.

Beyond aesthetics and comfort, the XUV 3XO incorporates advanced technology to enhance safety and driving experience. All models come standard with Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), including Autonomous Emergency Braking (AEB) with pedestrian and cyclist detection, Lane Departure Warning, Lane Keeping Assist, Traffic Sign Recognition, and Forward Collision Warning. Adaptive Cruise Control and Smart Pilot Assist enable Level 2 semi-autonomous driving, maintaining speed and distance to the car ahead and providing active lane keeping assistance on highways.

The XUV 3XO's competitive pricing makes its luxury features accessible to a broader range of customers. The top-spec AX7L variant offers a panoramic sunroof, dual 10.25-inch digital displays, 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, and a Harman Kardon stereo system at a price point that undercuts many of its rivals. Mahindra also offers a seven-year warranty, providing peace of mind and underscoring its commitment to quality. It competes with the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet, Hyundai Venue, MG ZS, and Chery Tiggo 4.

While the XUV 3XO offers a compelling value proposition, potential drawbacks include a smaller boot space (295 liters) compared to some competitors, which could be a concern for buyers prioritizing cargo capacity. Some reviewers have also noted that the steering feel can be disconnected, which may detract from the driving experience. Mahindra's after-sales service quality has been a concern in the past, although the company has been working to improve it. The polarizing exterior design may not appeal to everyone.

In summary, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is a feature-packed compact SUV that aims to deliver a premium experience at an affordable price. Its combination of stylish design, luxurious interior appointments, advanced technology, and competitive pricing makes it a compelling option in the crowded compact SUV segment. Potential buyers should weigh the benefits against the drawbacks and consider their individual needs and preferences before making a decision.

final_report.detailed:
Let me think through this: The Mahindra XUV 3XO represents a significant upgrade in the compact SUV segment, targeting value-conscious customers who seek a premium experience. Its exterior design is a departure from its predecessor, the XUV300, with a more modern and eye-catching aesthetic. The front fascia features vertically oriented headlights flanked by C-shaped DRLs, visually connecting it to the larger XUV700. Diamond-shaped detailing is evident in the lights and grille, adding a touch of sophistication. The new front bumper and contoured bonnet contribute to a more voluminous appearance. The available 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, the largest in the segment, enhance the vehicle's sporty appeal.

Inside, the XUV 3XO aims to elevate the cabin experience with premium features and materials. Reviews suggest interior quality comparable to Hyundai, a brand known for its well-appointed interiors. The dual 10.25-inch digital displays create a modern and immersive environment, with one serving as the infotainment screen and the other as the instrument cluster. Wireless Apple CarPlay and Android Auto connectivity provide seamless smartphone integration. Some models offer a panoramic sunroof, further enhancing the sense of spaciousness and luxury. The Harman Kardon audio system, a supplier to luxury brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz, delivers high-fidelity sound. Features like a 360-degree camera, auto headlamps and wipers, and wireless smartphone charging contribute to convenience and a premium feel.

Beyond aesthetics and comfort, the XUV 3XO incorporates advanced technology to enhance safety and driving experience. All models come standard with Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), including Autonomous Emergency Braking (AEB) with pedestrian and cyclist detection, Lane Departure Warning, Lane Keeping Assist, Traffic Sign Recognition, and Forward Collision Warning. Adaptive Cruise Control and Smart Pilot Assist enable Level 2 semi-autonomous driving, maintaining speed and distance to the car ahead and providing active lane keeping assistance on highways.

The XUV 3XO's competitive pricing makes its luxury features accessible to a broader range of customers. The top-spec AX7L variant offers a panoramic sunroof, dual 10.25-inch digital displays, 17-inch diamond-cut alloy wheels, and a Harman Kardon stereo system at a price point that undercuts many of its rivals. Mahindra also offers a seven-year warranty, providing peace of mind and underscoring its commitment to quality. It competes with the Tata Nexon, Maruti Brezza, Kia Sonet, Hyundai Venue, MG ZS, and Chery Tiggo 4.

While the XUV 3XO offers a compelling value proposition, potential drawbacks include a smaller boot space (295 liters) compared to some competitors, which could be a concern for buyers prioritizing cargo capacity. Some reviewers have also noted that the steering feel can be disconnected, which may detract from the driving experience. Mahindra's after-sales service quality has been a concern in the past, although the company has been working to improve it. The polarizing exterior design may not appeal to everyone.

In summary, the Mahindra XUV 3XO is a feature-packed compact SUV that aims to deliver a premium experience at an affordable price. Its combination of stylish design, luxurious interior appointments, advanced technology, and competitive pricing makes it a compelling option in the crowded compact SUV segment. Potential buyers should weigh the benefits against the drawbacks and consider their individual needs and preferences before making a decision.
